definitions.definition: Agreement or concurrence of opinion, will, or action.
A harmony in sound, pitch and tone ; concord .
Agreement or harmony of things in general.
examples: the accord of light and shade in painting

definitions.definition: A distinctive mixture of fragrances or the odor thereof.
An agreement between parties in controversy , by which satisfaction for an injury is stipulated , and which, when executed , prevents a lawsuit.

examples: The Geneva Accord of 1954 ended the French-Indochinese War.

definitions.definition: Voluntary or spontaneous impulse to act.
examples: Nobody told me to do it. I did it of my own accord .

main_definition: Agreement or concurrence of opinion, will, or action.
secondary_definitions: A harmony in sound, pitch and tone ; concord .
Agreement or harmony of things in general.
( countable , perfumery ) A distinctive mixture of fragrances or the odor thereof.
( law ) An agreement between parties in controversy , by which satisfaction for an injury is stipulated , and which, when executed , prevents a lawsuit.
Voluntary or spontaneous impulse to act.
